intro: Camelinopsis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their toxic sap. The plants typically have simple, lance-shaped leaves and produce showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Camelinopsis species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are adapted to withstand drought conditions, making them resilient plants in their native habitats.
